intro: Physurus micranthus, commonly known as the small-flowered burrweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and bristly seed pods. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and somewhat woody. Physurus micranthus is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry climates.
